question: Does every robotic cell have a corresponding media supply?
Are there media supplies without nearby media pipes?
Are the robot and its target position (e.g., intake station) on opposite sides of an expansion joint?
Are all robotic cells fully enclosed by fencing?
Do all robotic cells include a door in their fencing?
Do robots have the required equipment within reach (e.g., tip dresser)?
For welding stations, is a spray guard present to protect passing workers?
Do all columns in logistics areas have adequate ram protection?
Are enough fire extinguishers available?
Are fire extinguishers positioned so they are not easily struck by logistics equipment?
Does an articulated robot fit into this space?
Are evacuation paths free of blockages?
Is there enough space to remove defective products from the process?
Do interfering contours (robots, doors, etc.) avoid collisions?
Is there sufficient headroom for crane-based robot removal (maintenance)?
Is the lighting system present in this area?
Are enough sprinklers installed?
Does sprinkler water reach the required area without obstruction?
Do pipes pass through the required openings in metal or concrete structures?
Does equipment avoid collisions with steel structures such as mezzanines or stairs?
Is there sufficient headroom along logistics routes?
How many robots are present?
Do all main conveyors have uninterrupted clearance along their entire path?
Are major logistics racks positioned within their designated logistics zones?
Is the main aisle wide enough for tugger trains to pass without obstruction?
Where is the marriage station located?
Can you navigate to the end of this line?
How many boxes are in the component outfeed area?
What is the build state of the car at this location?
What process is performed at this station?
